meanings.definition: A solid geometric figure with two parallel and congruent bases, and sides that are parallelograms.
meanings.sent1: I learned about a prism in math class.
meanings.sent2: The prism on the table had a triangular shape.
meanings.sent3: The prism rolled off the desk and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a prism, reflecting different ideas.
meanings.sent5: The prism sparkled in the sunlight, showing its many sides.

meanings.definition: A transparent object that separates white light into a spectrum of colors.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a prism to split light into colors.
meanings.sent2: Rainbows are created when light passes through a prism.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the prism, creating a colorful display.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a prism, spreading joy in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The prism refracted the light beautifully, creating a rainbow effect.

meanings.definition: A method of surveying in which a series of connected triangular sections are used to determine the area and shape of a plot of land.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor used a prism to measure the land accurately.
meanings.sent2: A prism survey helps determine the boundaries of a property.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog accidentally knocked over the prism during the survey.
meanings.sent4: The prism of knowledge revealed the true extent of the land.
meanings.sent5: Using a prism for surveying ensures precise measurements of the plot.
